Articles.Content:
Having seen way to many Pumpkin Chunkin specials on Discovery...it dawned on me that this is an ideal Kerbal pursuit.

So...

It's Kerbal Chunkin Time!

Rule #1: At point of launch/release, your designated Kerbumpkin (Kerbanaut) shall fly unassisted and unattached to anything else.

Rule #2: Your chunkin apparatus must remain fixed/stationary on the launch pad.

Bragging rights for the following:

- Farthest Distance from KSP launch platform (screenshot)

- Highest Altitude Achieved (screenshot)

- Biggest Catastrophic Failure of Launch Apparatus (video required)

Restrictions:

No Mod restrictions, anything goes.

Please post a screenshot of your complete launcher so we can marvel at your Kerbal Skillz.

This challenge shall remain open for as long as people continue to submit and break records. The top 3 in each category will be periodically updated in this post.

Edited May 20, 2013 by BubbaWilkins

Here is Bob Kerman standing in front of the launching device (What's left of it anyways)

My flight results, highest altitute of 5383m

The only modded part I used was a smaller fuel tank from the KSPX pack, just so that the climb up the ramp wasn't as steep.

And yes, he survived the fall.

Here is Bob Kerman standing in front of the launching device (What's left of it anyways)

My flight results, highest altitute of 5383m

The only modded part I used was a smaller fuel tank from the KSPX pack, just so that the climb up the ramp wasn't as steep.

And yes, he survived the fall.

Ground distance?

Ground distance?

Oh damn, I thought I had it in the picture, I'll have to relaunch to find out ._. (wish I had saved the vehicle >_>) I'll do another run soon.

EDIT: here is my run, it wasn't as high as the last one (and I don't think it went as far over the ground either)

Edited May 20, 2013 by Tachy0n

Oh damn, I thought I had it in the picture, I'll have to relaunch to find out ._. (wish I had saved the vehicle >_>) I'll do another run soon.

EDIT: here is my run, it wasn't as high as the last one (and I don't think it went as far over the ground either)

Survived the fall also?

Meet KerbCannon 1.0, also known as "The Monster."

Note how the image is at nightÃ¢â‚¬â€œ we don't want people finding out about this piece of hardware... Actually the guys down in VR just don't know how to make a sun.

Meet Matsby Kerman, our VR test pilot. This might just be virtual reality, but he's still not sure about it...

The launch procedure is too fast to be seen, so let's just go to the results:

This is the best test so farÃ¢â‚¬â€œ over 5.3 kilometers... Straight. Up.

Nice view of Mun...

but Matsby isn't so sure this was a good idea.

It was an epic success! Don't worry about Matsby, I have it quicksaved (VR testing!) so he's not actually dead. 2.4 Gs is good, it won't kill you on launch, and while you can't see it, Matsby broke the speed of sound on his way up.

Final verdict? The KerbCannon 1.0 is fantastic! For going straight up... Imagine this on Minmus! (I'll do that for kicks once Extraplanetary Space Centers is out)

It seems that kerbals are much more aerodynamic with the FAR mod, so it might be a bit unfair.

Here's my kannon.

It launched the kerbal 64km and the launch clamps followed him the whole way.

And so I built one to shoot him up.

Of course I forgot to take a picture of the results, but if you can trust me, it was 51km

Maybe FAR shouldn't be allowed.

Alright, so here's mine:

The launcher:

In action:

Not Kerbal enough...need MOAR!

Mark II:

Woohoo!:

Best shot of the night (and he lived!):

Edited May 21, 2013 by BubbaWilkins

something other than a kerbal cannon!! quite impressive!

do you have a craft file for that?

omfg yes! Punkin Chunkin is so much fun to watch XD here's my entry, a "kannon" with 20 mainsails that pretty much obliterates itself when it's fired (video coming soon XD):

Yeah, there are reentry effects on the way up... 51 km and change, NOT using the FAR mod

After going splat: (I didn't even know it was possible to damage Kerbals with engine exhaust!) Ground distance is pretty far as well, so I'll include this entry in both categories (height and distance)

Edited May 21, 2013 by Ekku Zakku

something other than a kerbal cannon!! quite impressive!

do you have a craft file for that?

I created a new game just for this, so I should be able to find the save file. I'll try to post up later this evening with it.

I created a new game just for this, so I should be able to find the save file. I'll try to post up later this evening with it.

Well, turns out I didn't save the craft and had a cannon built in it's place. oh well.
